summary: The Insurrection Act of 2025 amends Title 10 of the United States Code to define the circumstances under which the President can deploy the Armed Forces domestically to suppress insurrection or rebellion, quell domestic violence, or enforce the law. It outlines triggering conditions (e.g., overwhelming state/local authorities, obstruction of law), the President's authority (subject to limitations), required Congressional consultation and reporting, and procedures for Congressional approval of the use of force. The bill also includes provisions for judicial review and defines 'State' for this purpose.
